Events.text: The Roman Empire lays siege to Betar, effectively ending the Bar Kokhba revolt.
Events.html: The Roman Empire lays siege to Betar, effectively ending the Bar Kokhba revolt.

Events.text: The Republic of Pisa is defeated in the Battle of Meloria by the Republic of Genoa, thus losing its naval dominance in the Mediterranean.
Events.html: The Republic of Pisa is defeated in the Battle of Meloria by the Republic of Genoa, thus losing its naval dominance in the Mediterranean.

Events.text: The Grand Duchy of Lithuania defeated the Crimean Khanate in the Battle of Kletsk
Events.html: The Grand Duchy of Lithuania defeated the Crimean Khanate in the Battle of Kletsk

Events.text: Bogotá, Colombia, is founded by Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada.
Events.html: Bogotá, Colombia, is founded by Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada.

Events.text: The Treaty of The Hague is signed by Portugal and the Dutch Republic.
Events.html: The Treaty of The Hague is signed by Portugal and the Dutch Republic.

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: The bloody Battle of Oriskany prevents American relief of the Siege of Fort Stanwix.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: The bloody Battle of Oriskany prevents American relief of the Siege of Fort Stanwix.

Events.text: Sixty proof sheets of the Constitution of the United States are delivered to the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
Events.html: Sixty proof sheets of the Constitution of the United States are delivered to the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Events.text: Francis II, the last Holy Roman Emperor, abdicates, ending the Holy Roman Empire.
Events.html: Francis II, the last Holy Roman Emperor, abdicates, ending the Holy Roman Empire.

Events.text: Norwich University is founded in Vermont as the first private military school in the United States.
Events.html: Norwich University is founded in Vermont as the first private military school in the United States.

Events.text: Battle of Junín Peru.
Events.html: Battle of Junín Peru.

Events.text: Bolivia gains independence from Spain.
Events.html: Bolivia gains independence from Spain.

Events.text: The United Kingdom annexes Lagos, Nigeria.
Events.html: The United Kingdom annexes Lagos, Nigeria.

Events.text: American Civil War: The Confederate ironclad CSS Arkansas is scuttled on the Mississippi River after suffering catastrophic engine failure near Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
Events.html: American Civil War: The Confederate ironclad CSS Arkansas is scuttled on the Mississippi River after suffering catastrophic engine failure near Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

Events.text: Franco-Prussian War: The Battle of Spicheren is fought, resulting in a Prussian victory.
Events.html: Franco-Prussian War: The Battle of Spicheren is fought, resulting in a Prussian victory.

Events.text: Franco-Prussian War: The Battle of Wörth results in a decisive Prussian victory.
Events.html: 1870 – Franco-Prussian War: The Battle of Wörth results in a decisive Prussian victory.

Events.text: At Auburn Prison in New York, murderer William Kemmler becomes the first person to be executed by electric chair.
Events.html: At Auburn Prison in New York, murderer William Kemmler becomes the first person to be executed by electric chair.

Events.text: Kiowa land in Oklahoma is opened for white settlement, effectively dissolving the contiguous reservation.
Events.html: Kiowa land in Oklahoma is opened for white settlement, effectively dissolving the contiguous reservation.

Events.text: The Bull Moose Party meets at the Chicago Coliseum.
Events.html: The Bull Moose Party meets at the Chicago Coliseum.

Events.text: World War I: First Battle of the Atlantic: Two days after the United Kingdom had declared war on Germany over the German invasion of Belgium, ten German U-boats leave their base in Heligoland to attack Royal Navy warships in the North Sea.
Events.html: World War I: First Battle of the Atlantic: Two days after the United Kingdom had declared war on Germany over the German invasion of Belgium, ten German U-boats leave their base in Heligoland to attack Royal Navy warships in the North Sea.

Events.text: World War I: Serbia declares war on Germany; Austria declares war on Russia.
Events.html: 1914 – World War I: Serbia declares war on Germany; Austria declares war on Russia.

Events.text: World War I: Battle of Sari Bair: The Allies mount a diversionary attack timed to coincide with a major Allied landing of reinforcements at Suvla Bay.
Events.html: World War I: Battle of Sari Bair: The Allies mount a diversionary attack timed to coincide with a major Allied landing of reinforcements at Suvla Bay.

Events.text: World War I: Battle of Mărășești between the Romanian and German armies begins.
Events.html: World War I: Battle of Mărășești between the Romanian and German armies begins.

Events.text: Gertrude Ederle becomes the first woman to swim across the English Channel.
Events.html: Gertrude Ederle becomes the first woman to swim across the English Channel.

Events.text: In New York City, the Warner Bros.' Vitaphone system premieres with the movie Don Juan starring John Barrymore.
Events.html: 1926 – In New York City, the Warner Bros.' Vitaphone system premieres with the movie Don Juan starring John Barrymore.

Events.text: Judge Joseph Force Crater steps into a taxi in New York and disappears never to be seen again.
Events.html: Judge Joseph Force Crater steps into a taxi in New York and disappears never to be seen again.

Events.text: Estonia was illegally annexed by the Soviet Union.
Events.html: Estonia was illegally annexed by the Soviet Union.

Events.text: Queen Wilhelmina of the Netherlands becomes the first reigning queen to address a joint session of the United States Congress.
Events.html: Queen Wilhelmina of the Netherlands becomes the first reigning queen to address a joint session of the United States Congress.

Events.text: The Warsaw Uprising occurs on August 1. It is brutally suppressed and all able-bodied men in Kraków are detained afterwards to prevent a similar uprising, the Kraków Uprising, that was planned but never carried out.
Events.html: The Warsaw Uprising occurs on August 1. It is brutally suppressed and all able-bodied men in Kraków are detained afterwards to prevent a similar uprising, the Kraków Uprising, that was planned but never carried out.

Events.text: World War II: Hiroshima, Japan is devastated when the atomic bomb "Little Boy" is dropped by the United States B-29 Enola Gay. Around 70,000 people are killed instantly, and some tens of thousands die in subsequent years from burns and radiation poisoning.
Events.html: World War II: Hiroshima, Japan is devastated when the atomic bomb "Little Boy" is dropped by the United States B-29 Enola Gay. Around 70,000 people are killed instantly, and some tens of thousands die in subsequent years from burns and radiation poisoning.

links.title: Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

Events.text: After going bankrupt in 1955, the American broadcaster DuMont Television Network makes its final broadcast, a boxing match from St. Nicholas Arena in New York in the Boxing from St. Nicholas Arena series.
Events.html: After going bankrupt in 1955, the American broadcaster DuMont Television Network makes its final broadcast, a boxing match from St. Nicholas Arena in New York in the Boxing from St. Nicholas Arena series.

Events.text: Cuban Revolution: Cuba nationalizes American and foreign-owned property in the nation.
Events.html: Cuban Revolution: Cuba nationalizes American and foreign-owned property in the nation.

Events.text: Jamaica becomes independent from the United Kingdom.
Events.html: Jamaica becomes independent from the United Kingdom.

Events.text: US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Voting Rights Act of 1965 into law.
Events.html: US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Voting Rights Act of 1965 into law.

Events.text: A low-pressure system that redeveloped off the New South Wales coast dumps a record 328 millimeters (13 inches) of rain in a day on Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.
Events.html: A low-pressure system that redeveloped off the New South Wales coast dumps a record 328 millimeters (13 inches) of rain in a day on Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.

Events.text: Gulf War: The United Nations Security Council orders a global trade embargo against Iraq in response to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait.
Events.html: Gulf War: The United Nations Security Council orders a global trade embargo against Iraq in response to Iraq's invasion of Kuwait.

Events.text: Tim Berners-Lee releases files describing his idea for the World Wide Web. WWW debuts as a publicly available service on the Internet.
Events.html: Tim Berners-Lee releases files describing his idea for the World Wide Web. WWW debuts as a publicly available service on the Internet.

Events.text: Takako Doi, chair of the Social Democratic Party, becomes Japan's first female speaker of the House of Representatives.
Events.html: 1991 – Takako Doi, chair of the Social Democratic Party, becomes Japan's first female speaker of the House of Representatives.

Events.text: The Ramones played their farewell concert at The Palace, Los Angeles, CA.
Events.html: The Ramones played their farewell concert at The Palace, Los Angeles, CA.

Events.text: NASA announces that the ALH 84001 meteorite, thought to originate from Mars, contains evidence of primitive life-forms.
Events.html: 1996 – NASA announces that the ALH 84001 meteorite, thought to originate from Mars, contains evidence of primitive life-forms.

Events.text: Korean Air Flight 801 crashed at Nimitz Hill, Guam killing 228 of 254 people on board.
Events.html: Korean Air Flight 801 crashed at Nimitz Hill, Guam killing 228 of 254 people on board.

Events.text: Erwadi fire incident, 28 mentally ill persons tied to a chain were burnt to death at a faith based institution at Erwadi, Tamil Nadu.
Events.html: Erwadi fire incident, 28 mentally ill persons tied to a chain were burnt to death at a faith based institution at Erwadi, Tamil Nadu.

Events.text: A military junta led by Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz stages a coup d'état in Mauritania, overthrowing president Sidi Ould Cheikh Abdallahi.
Events.html: A military junta led by Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz stages a coup d'état in Mauritania, overthrowing president Sidi Ould Cheikh Abdallahi.

Events.text: Flash floods across a large part of Jammu and Kashmir, India, damages 71 towns and kills at least 255 people.
Events.html: Flash floods across a large part of Jammu and Kashmir, India, damages 71 towns and kills at least 255 people.

Events.text: War in Afghanistan: A United States military helicopter is shot down, killing 30 American special forces members and a working dog, 7 Afghan soldiers, and 1 Afghan civilian. It was the deadliest single event for the United States in the War in Afghanistan.
Events.html: 2011 – War in Afghanistan: A United States military helicopter is shot down, killing 30 American special forces members and a working dog, 7 Afghan soldiers, and 1 Afghan civilian. It was the deadliest single event for the United States in the War in Afghanistan.

Events.text: NASA's Curiosity rover lands on the surface of Mars.
Events.html: NASA's Curiosity rover lands on the surface of Mars.

Events.text: A suicide bomb attack kills at least 15 people at a mosque in the Saudi city of Abha.
Events.html: A suicide bomb attack kills at least 15 people at a mosque in the Saudi city of Abha.
